title.narrative: 3.4 ADOLESCENT LIFESKILLS & ENTREPRENEUR

description.narrative: By 2017, in selected districts and municipalities, adolescent girls and boys are applying age, sex, and issue appropriate life skills to influence decisions that affect their development, which contributes to Adolescent Empowerment, Adolescents And Hiv/Aids, Cross-Sectoral Adolescent Development, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Violence, Exploitation And Abuse. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2017, in selected areas, children, adolescents, women and men, and all relevant duty-bearers are engaged in social change and action to realize the survival, development, protection and participation rights of children, adolescents and women with equity in all contexts, including humanitarian situations

participating-org.narrative: EKDARA GA PA GA KA PA OFFICE

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2017, in selected districts and municipalities, adolescent girls and boys are applying age, sex, and issue appropriate lifeskills to influence decisions that affect their development

description.narrative: Nearly thirty-five thousand (34,459) adolescents equipped with social and financial knowledge and skills to influence and participate in decisions affecting their lives | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2017

title.narrative: % of adolescent girls and boys participating life skills interventions report significant positive change in their lives (Verified through MSC methodology)

actual.value: 2017:100% adolescents who submitted stories reported a positive change in their lives (verified through MSC methodology on a sample basis)

title.narrative: % of adolescent girls and boys attending life skills interventions participating in social actions to address harmful social practices in their communities

actual.value: 2017:Information on this indicator will be available in January 2018 after completing the post test results of the Rupantaran participants.

title.narrative: % of adolescent girls and boys from intervention areas, including differently abled, participated in sports and other recreational activities (disaggregated by age, ethnicity, and wealth)

actual.value: 2017:47% of adolescents from the intervention areas participated in sports and other recreational activities.
